title: Five-year-old battles rabies in Kerala’s Kannur; jackal attack adds to scare
content: The boy sustained bites on eye and leg. Though he was vaccinated immediately, doctors said facial wounds allowed virus to reach brain

title: Prayoga and SBI Foundation join hands to transform science education for primary school students in Raichur
content: The collaboration is part of SBIF’s Integrated Learning Mission (ILM) titled Reimagining Science Education

title: Hope PM will finally agree to debate on China during Parliament’s Monsoon session: Congress
content: The Opposition party also said it is important to collectively work towards a national consensus on vital national security and economic challenges posed by China’s emergence

title: Nilambur bypoll in Kerala: Polling progresses on a brisk note
content: Many voters reached the polling stations well before polling started at 7 a.m. Polling will continue until 6 p.m.

title: Air India plane crash: Body of co-pilot Clive Kunder brought home
content: The ill-fated flight was under the command of Captain Sumeet Sabharwal along with First Officer Clive Kunder

title: Students evacuated from Iran to be brought back in deluxe buses: J&K CM
content: As many as 90 students from Jammu and Kashmir were among the 110 people evacuated from war-affected Iran

title: Row over Hindi: Marathi literary body opposes three-language formula
content: The Mahamandal also questioned the need to teach a third language when many schools do not have enough teachers, and students of higher classes struggle to read Marathi books of Class 2 level

title: Despite Supreme Court backing, ‘Thug Life’ release doubtful in Karnataka
content: Kamal Haasan’s ‘Thug Life’ is faces rejection from Karnataka distributors due to its poor box office performance across the country

title: PM to flag off first indigenous locomotive for export to Guinea on June 20 in Bihar
content: The Marhowrah facility will supply 150 locomotives worth more than ₹3,000 crore for the iron ore project in Guinea

title: 'Despicable': Allahabad High Court slams family's objection to woman marrying person of choice
content: “The fact that there is social and familial resistance to the exercise of such right is a glaring depiction of the ‘value gap’ between the constitutional norms and those social”

title: Without addressing inequalities, no nation can claim to be truly democratic: CJI Gavai
content: The CJI said that it is not merely a matter of redistribution or welfare but it is also about enabling every person to live with dignity, to realise their full human potential, and to participate as equals

title: Assembly bypolls 2025 LIVE: Brisk voting underway in five constituencies in four States
content: Bypolls is being held in two Assembly constituencies in Gujarat and one each in Kerala, West Bengal and Punjab

title: PM Modi concludes visit to Croatia after meeting top leadership
content: Mr. Modi held delegation-level talks with Plenković and met President Zoran Milanovic to discuss a range of issues to boost bilateral ties.

title: Yoga Day preparations lead to traffic congestion in Vizag
content: Entry of vehicles from Jodugullapalem to RK Beach restricted; DSC candidates advised to start early for the exam today

title: Flight carrying 110 Indian students, evacuated from war-torn Iran under Operation Sindhu; lands in Delhi
content: At the Indira Gandhi Airport, New Delhi, families of students from the north Indian states queued up to welcome their children, while officials from the southern states and that of J&K waited to escort them to their home states

title: Heavy rains: Outflow from Kabini reservoir increased, Hemavati dam shutters to be opened
content: Increased outflow from Kabini reservoir prompts flood warning in Karnataka; residents urged to move to higher ground for safety

title: Tata Group chairman N. Chandrasekaran 'apologises' for Ahmedabad Air India plane crash
content: Mr. Chandrasekaran acknowledged Air India needs to do a better job of communicating with passengers about these matters

title: MP expresses concern about ‘tardy progress’ of Ernakulam Junction redevelopment work
content: Mr. Eden sought steps to build a foot overbridge linking the Thripunithura railway and metro stations.

title: Preferential treatment raises eyebrows
content: Preferential treatment for the mighty would undermine the foundation of the rule of law and public trust in the system

title: Metro Rail slaps ₹1 cr. fine on contractor, removes four staff after girder crash
content: According to officials, following an inquiry, four persons who were directly responsible for the incident have been removed from the project.

title: CTH Road needs to be widened to boost Thiruninravur’s development, say residents
content: The suburb lacks major hospitals, hotels and parking spaces; there aren’t enough bus and rail services to this thickly populated area, say residents; they demand better connectivity to places such as Kilambakkam, Tirupati and Tiruvallur

title: Warangal students win $5,000 in prestigious Generative AI Hackathon
content: Their project, Content Hub, stood out for its innovative approach to AI-driven social media engagement

title: TGCSB and NALSAR sign pact to strengthen cyber law enforcement in Telangana
content: The collaboration seeks to merge legal education, policy research and forensic capabilities with the TGCSB’s operational expertise, creating a multidisciplinary framework to tackle cybercrime

title: BSNL building AI system to identify and correct defects in services: CMD
content: Multinational companies took years to stabilise, said Ravi, and insisted that the BSNL 4G speeds are much better than that of its competitors

title: Teachers protest after dead lizards were found in snack at Madras varsity
content: The incident happened at the Guindy campus of the university; the dead lizards were found in sundal that was offered to the teachers as a mid-morning snack

title: Telangana man dies of ill-health in Israel
content: He was admitted to hospital three weeks ago and died while undergoing treatment earlier this week, said representatives of Israel Telangana Association

title: CPI(M) on the back foot as its 1977 alliance with Jan Sangh resurfaces
content: An alleged revelation by CPI(M) State secretary M.V. Govindan during a media interview about the alliance puts the LDF on the defensive with the rival United Democratic Front (UDF) seizing the opportunity to capitalise on the dispute

title: CM to inaugurate urban health centre in Adyar next month
content: Protein kit for dialysis patients undergoing renal dialysis were launched at Rajiv Gandhi Government General Hospital

title: Raj Bhavan not a platform for RSS agenda, says Kerala Chief Minister amid portrait row
content: Pinarayi says it is unacceptable to make the Governor’s residence a venue for pushing the RSS agenda. This trend is a direct challenge to the Constitution.

title: Tamil Nadu’s pregnancy registration system exposes Aadhaar tampering to hide child marriages in Krishnagiri
content: The Collector’s visit followed the detection of six persons as underage mothers though their Aadhaar cards showed a different date of birth.

title: Extraction will start in six sand blocks in non-CRZ areas soon: Dinesh Gundu Rao
content: District Sand Monitoring Committee had identified 11 sand blocks in the non-CRZ area and tenders were floated for six blocks, he says

title: CID cracks multi-state job visa fraud; over 100 victims duped
content: Secunderabad-based Eagle Expert Immigration Consultancy duped people by guaranteeing them employment overseas especially in Malta

title: Hindi as third language in Maharashtra schools receives flak, Opposition calls it ‘betrayal’
content: According to the amended Government Resolution (GR) issued on Tuesday, Hindi will be the third language in Marathi and English medium schools for classes 1 to 5; but students were allowed to choose from other Indian languages in the place of Hindi

title: SSUS to host Kerala Institute for Gender Equity
content: The institute aims at integrating gender perspectives into policy-making, addressing gender inequalities, and sharing research outcomes with institutions and partners across the country

title: Two Congress MLAs jailed for blocking Jaipur road in 2014
content: Congress MLAs Mukesh Bhakar, elected from Ladnun, and Manish Yadav, representing Shahpura, were among the student leaders who staged a protest and blocked Jawaharlal Nehru Marg outside the university’s gate for about 20 minutes on August 13, 2014

title: Kashmiri youth who was facing detention under PSA cracks NEET
content: Sajad Lone said on Wednesday (June 18, 2025) that he had intervened with the police to prevent Zubair’s booking under the PSA

title: State governments duty-bound to provide judicial infrastructure without citing excuses, says Madras High Court
content: Chief Justice K.R. Shriram and Justice Sunder Mohan direct Tamil Nadu government to sanction one additional member for Tamil Nadu State Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission

title: Air India to cut 15% of widebody operated international flights
content: Decision taken mitigate impact of a combination of factors, including inspections and airspace restrictions in West Asia

title: Suspend BJP’s Bhopal MP from Lok Sabha for recent ‘communal remarks’: CPI(M) to President
content: In letters to President and LS Speaker, CPI(M) State secretary accuses Bhopal MP of making “derogatory slurs” against Muslims, violating Articles 15 and 21 of the Constitution with comments on “love jihad”

title: Leaders close to CM Nitish Kumar blocking his son’s entry into politics, says Tejashwi Yadav
content: He also alleged that close aides are taking the advantage of Mr. Kumar’s declining mental acuity and also misusing him to enjoy power

title: Sahitya Akademi Yuva Puraskar announced for 23 writers, and Bal Puraskar for 24 authors
content: The Yuva Puraskar awardees include Advait Kottary in English, Parvati Tirkey in Hindi, Latshmihar for Tamil and Prasad Suri for Telugu

title: India and Croatia to make long term plans for defence cooperation: PM Modi
content: India will enhance investment into Croatia’s critical industries like pharma, agriculture, IT, clean technology, digital technology, semiconductors, Mr. Modi said

title: Chhattisgarh to widen government appointments for kin of cops killed in Maoist violence
content: Such appointments on compassionate grounds will no longer be limited to the same department where the deceased was employed; State Cabinet nod to set up Chhattisgarh Tiger Foundation Society

title: States’ report card: Chandigarh is best performer in school education, Meghalaya at the bottom
content: The Education Ministry’s Performance Grade Index 2.0 report for 2023-24 shows improvements by 24 States/UTs, and declines by 12; Bihar, Telangana show most improvement in access to education

title: Two dead, three critically injured in landslide on Kedarnath trek route
content: The incident took place near the same spot where a pilgrim died after getting hit by landslide on Sunday.

title: Former MLA P.J. Francis passes away
content: He defeated CPI(M) veteran V.S. Achuthanandan in the Mararikulam Assembly constituency by a margin of 1,965 votes in the 1996 elections

title: There’s growing paranoia about air travel, government should strengthen air safety on ground, rebuild public trust, Congress leader says
content: Separately, former Aviation Minister Praful Patel questioned the silence of Singapore Airlines, which owns a 25.1% stake in Air India, on the Ahmedabad air crash; Singapore Airlines in a statement said it was offering full support and assistance to Tata Sons

title: Defending Saharanpur MP Imran Masood’s remarks, U.P. Congress chief says the INDIA bloc is united
content: The ‘Lok Sabha formula’ would not work for the U.P. Assembly election, Masood has said, persisting with his demand for a reset in seat sharing between the Congress and SP

title: Don’t fall prey to fraudsters promising medical seats, says Minister
content: Karnataka Examination Authority will ensure a smooth and transparent process, according to Sharan Prakash Patil

title: 'Reason I had him here was ... ': Trump shares why Pak army chief was invited to WH
content: US President Donald Trump claimed credit for preventing a war between India and Pakistan, citing the influence of Pakistan's Army Chief General Asim Munir. Trump stated he thanked Munir for "ending" the conflict. He also mentioned ongoing trade deal discussions with both India and Pakistan, following recent talks with Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

title: 'Women's cricket ke liye eligible hoon': Anaya Bangar urges ICC, BCCI to include transgenders
content: Anaya Bangar, child of former Indian cricketer Sanjay Bangar, is advocating for transgender cricketers' inclusion in women's cricket. Anaya has urged the ICC and BCCI to reconsider the current ban. Anaya is submitting an eight-page scientific report detailing her transition and physiological assessments after hormone therapy, demonstrating alignment with cisgender female athlete norms.

title: Intel layoffs: 10,000+ factory workers to be laid off; Why they won’t be getting any severance
content: Intel is set to implement significant layoffs, impacting 15% to 20% of its Intel Foundry workforce starting in July, potentially affecting over 10,000 employees globally. This move is part of CEO Lip-Bu Tan's restructuring efforts to cut costs and streamline operations amidst financial struggles and intense market competition.

title: Israel issues new evacuation warning in Iran; is a US strike on cards? 10 key developments
content: Amid escalating conflict, Israel continues strikes in Iran, prompting US consideration of military action. US President Trump hints at potential US involvement and reveals Iran's interest in talks. Russia offers mediation. India, under Operation Sindhu, evacuates 110 Indian nationals from Iran. Casualties in Iran rise to 639, according to Human Rights Activists, while Supreme Leader Khamenei vows no surrender.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Karma is unforgiving' - Mukesh shares cryptic post after Harshit gets India call-up
content: India's Test squad sees a late change as Harshit Rana joins the team for the England series, following his India-A performance. This decision has sparked debate, especially after Mukesh Kumar's cryptic social media post and criticism from Dodda Ganesh, who suggested Anshul Kamboj's inclusion.

title: ‘Kyu nahi ho rahi acting?’: Aamir trolled for mimicking Carlsen’s Norway Chess viral outburst – Watch
content: Aamir Khan's recent attempt to recreate Magnus Carlsen's viral outburst after losing to D Gukesh has sparked mixed reactions online. In a reel with influencer Prakhar Gupta, Khan mimics Carlsen's table-slam, poking fun at his own 'Mr. Perfectionist' image. While some appreciated the self-deprecating humor, many criticized the performance, labeling it as 'overacting.

title: AI is your intern today: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman to software engineers; but soon …
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman envisions AI evolving from an 'intern' to a seasoned software engineer, potentially revolutionizing coding roles. He anticipates AI agents tackling complex business problems and discovering new knowledge soon. While this shift demands software engineers focus on AI management and innovation, concerns arise about AI's impact on employment, with predictions of significant job displacement in white-collar sectors.

title: Spooky discovery: Bones, skulls found at Bengaluru apartment complex
content: Skeletal remains were unexpectedly unearthed during a routine cleaning of percolation pits at a Bengaluru apartment complex, unsettling residents and prompting a police investigation. The discovery, which included suspected skull fragments, occurred in Industrial Layout, Begur, on June 16.

title: AI crash: Govt tightens aircraft safety rules; structures violating height limit under lens
content: Following the Air India crash in Ahmedabad, the civil aviation ministry has released draft rules targeting structures posing risks to aircraft. These rules empower authorities to act against buildings and trees exceeding height limits near aerodromes. Owners of non-compliant structures face notices, potential demolition, and can appeal orders, but compensation is limited to those who comply with initial directives.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 near 24,800; BSE Sensex opens in red
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in red on Thursday following global cues. While Nifty50 was near 24,800, BSE Sensex was below 81,450.

title: Steve Jobs’ expensive gift: When Apple founder gifted Jaguar to secretary; said ‘don’t be…’
content: Steve Jobs, known for his demanding leadership, once gifted a late secretary a Jaguar to prevent future tardiness, showcasing his paradoxical nature of being both intimidating and inspiring. Ron Givens, Apple's former quality director, shared anecdotes of Jobs' unexpected generosity and relentless pursuit of excellence. Jobs' high expectations extended to late-night calls, as recalled by Pixar's Pete Docter.

title: Chess: Why was Carlsen upset after loss to Gukesh? Caruana explains
content: Magnus Carlsen's fist smash at Norway Chess, following a loss to Gukesh, sparked widespread attention, overshadowing their game. Caruana shared insights on Carlsen's motivation against Gukesh, emphasising the significance of defeating the world champion. Caruana also acknowledged Gukesh's strong performances over the past year and his own expectations to compete with the rising Indian chess talents.

title: After 12/6, demand for AI’s 787s down; airline to cut overseas flights
content: Following the AI 171 crash, Air India's Boeing 787 flights are experiencing lower demand, leading to cheaper fares compared to competitors on routes to Europe, the UK, the Far East, and Australia. Despite other airlines also using B787s on these routes, passengers are opting for alternatives, including one-stop flights, due to safety concerns.

title: Two Indian nationals jailed in US for phishing scam targeting elderly
content: Two Indian students in the US have been sentenced to federal prison for separate fraud schemes targeting elderly Americans. Kishan Rajeshkumar Patel received over 5 years for defrauding victims of nearly $2.7 million by impersonating government officials. Moinuddin Mohammed was sentenced to eight years for a similar scam resulting in $6 million in losses.

title: Wayne Gretzky opens up about how his father tried to stop nickname from sticking
content: Wayne Gretzky's iconic nickname, 'The Great One,' faced initial resistance from his father, Walter. Despite concerns about pressure, the name stuck as Gretzky dominated youth hockey. He later embraced it, exceeding expectations with a record-breaking NHL career. Gretzky also commented on the Edmonton Oilers' recent loss to the Florida Panthers. His journey reflects humility, brilliance, and lasting greatness in hockey.

title: Sunjay Kapur funeral: Businessman's last rites to be held in Delhi today
content: Industrialist Sunjay Kapur's funeral will be held in New Delhi today, June 19, with final rites at 5 PM at Lodhi Road Cremation Ground. A prayer meet is scheduled for June 22 at the Taj Palace Hotel. Kapur, 53, passed away on June 12 in London, reportedly from a heart attack.

title: Brandon Aiyuk sends clear message to San Francisco 49ers
content: Kansas City Chiefs may target Brandon Aiyuk before the 2025 season. Aiyuk seeks a long-term deal, around $23 million annually. This move could boost the Chiefs' offense and aid Patrick Mahomes. Aiyuk hinted at leaving the 49ers. Experts suggest the Chiefs will pursue Aiyuk if he is available. Mahomes has been training with young receivers.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock recommendations for June 19, 2025 - check list
content: Top stock market recommendations: Aakash K Hindocha from Nuvama Professional Clients Group recommends Kaynes, Mahanagar Gas Limited (MGL), and Gland Pharma as top stock picks for today. Nifty is expected to consolidate between 24650 and 25050, while Bank Nifty ranges from 55400 to 56200.

title: EXCLUSIVE | 'Gill-led India in same situation as MS Dhoni's T20 WC team': WV Raman
content: WV Raman draws parallels between the young Indian squad led by Shubman Gill and the 2007 T20 World Cup-winning team, highlighting the advantage of low expectations. The former India cricketer also emphasises on the importance of support for the new captain, Shubman Gill, and strategic role allocation within the team.

title: QS World University rankings: MIT retains top spot; see how Indian universities fared
content: The QS World University Rankings 2026 names MIT as the top global university, with Imperial College London in second place. The rankings highlight a growing academic influence in Asia, featuring 565 ranked universities. Notable shifts include IIT Delhi becoming India’s highest-ranked institution and McGill leading in Canada. Over 1,500 universities across 106 countries were evaluated, with the U.S. and UK dominating the top 10. The data signals an increasingly competitive, globalised academic landscape.

title: Influencer Kirti Patel arrested in Ahmedabad; honey-trapped builder
content: Surat police apprehended Kirti Patel, a notorious history-sheeter, after a year-long search in connection with a Rs 2 crore extortion case. Patel, despite being a fugitive, maintained a public presence on Instagram. She and her accomplices allegedly honey-trapped a builder, using compromising photos to extort money. Patel faces multiple FIRs across Gujarat for various offenses, including attempted murder and extortion.

title: US 'doomsday plane' flies to Washington; what it means
content: Amid rising tensions between Iran and Israel, a US E-4B Nightwatch doomsday plane made a rare flight to Joint Base Andrews. This mobile command post, designed for nuclear conflict or national emergencies, took an unusual route and used a different callsign, sparking speculation.

title: 'Kohli yes, but not Rohit ' - Ex-England skipper picks combined post-2000 Test XI
content: Cricket fans are excited for the India versus England Test series. Former players are picking their dream teams. Nasser Hussain left out Rohit Sharma. He thinks England will win 3-1. Graeme Swann predicts a 4-1 victory for England. Key Indian players like Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma may not play. Shubman Gill will lead India. Ben Stokes captains England.

title: Op Sindhu: First rescue flight carrying 110 Indian students lands in Delhi
content: Amidst escalating tensions between Iran and Israel, India has launched Operation Sindhu to evacuate its citizens from Iran. The first flight, carrying 110 Indian citizens, mostly students, landed in New Delhi from Yerevan, Armenia. The Indian Embassy in Tehran facilitated the safe relocation of students from the city.

title: Tougher rules for foreign students; Trump team enforces social media checks
content: The Trump administration has resumed student visa interviews, requiring applicants to make their social media accounts public for review. Refusal to do so could lead to visa rejection, as officials will scrutinize posts for hostility towards the U.S. This decision comes after a temporary halt and aims to thoroughly vet applicants before the start of the academic year.

title: Assembly bypolls: Elections in Bengal, Kerala, Punjab, Gujarat today
content: Assembly bypolls across Gujarat, Kerala, West Bengal, and Punjab are being closely watched as the first electoral test post the Pahalgam terror attack and Operation Sindoor. These elections are particularly significant in Kerala and West Bengal, where assembly elections are due early next year.

title: Vance banned from liberal social media Bluesky; platform blames error; account restored
content: US Vice President JD Vance faced a brief suspension from Bluesky soon after his first post. Bluesky stated that the account was flagged as a fake due to impersonation attempts. The account was restored within 20 minutes with a verification badge. Vance shared his views on a Supreme Court ruling and transgender medical treatments.

title: Who Is Mark Walter? Man behind Lakers’ $10 B takeover- all you need to know about him
content: Mark Walter is set to become the new majority owner of the Los Angeles Lakers. The Buss family is selling the NBA franchise for $10 billion. Walter already owns stakes in several sports teams. He has a successful track record with the Los Angeles Dodgers. Walter's purchase brings stability and a winning blueprint to the Lakers.

title: India and Canada to reinstate High Commissioners, restart trade talks
content: Narendra Modi and Mark Carney met to improve India-Canada relations. They agreed to bring back high commissioners soon. Trade talks that stopped will start again. Both leaders want to fix things and build trust. They talked about security and economic growth. Discussions also covered climate change and technology.

title: 'I have plan for everything': Trump doesn’t confirm strike on Iran; but leaves options open
content: Amid escalating conflict between Israel and Iran, US president Donald Trump remains ambiguous about potential military action against Iran. He stated having “a plan for everything” but offered no specifics, hinting at possible future talks while emphasising Iran's past rejection of a deal. Tehran faces severe consequences with Israeli airstrikes, deserted streets, disrupted services.

title: 30 or 45 minutes: Which is the ideal time for a daily walk
content: Walking, a simple yet effective exercise, offers numerous physical and mental benefits. Aiming for 30 minutes of brisk walking daily aligns with health guidelines, reducing risks of heart disease and improving mood.

title: 'You're the best': Italian PM Meloni tells PM Modi in Canada
content: At the G7 Summit in Canada, PM Narendra Modi and Italian PM Giorgia Meloni displayed a strong rapport, exchanging warm greetings and compliments. Meloni praised Modi, acknowledging their friendship. Both leaders affirmed the strengthening ties between Italy and India, highlighting their camaraderie at various global events like COP in Dubai and G20 summits.

title: Heart health: Not yoga, not a workout—but most people fail this simple heart test
content: A simple 'Sitting-Rising Test' (SRT), involving sitting and standing without support, can indicate cardiovascular health and longevity, says scientists. A study in the European Journal of Preventive Cardiology found that individuals with low SRT scores faced a significantly higher risk of mortality from heart issues. The test assesses strength, balance, and flexibility, reflecting overall functional fitness.

title: 'Regime could fall': Trump says no decision yet on joining Israel in bombing Iran
content: President Trump has not decided on joining Israel in strikes against Iran, but suggested the regime could collapse. He hinted at potential US action regarding Iran's nuclear facilities, stating a turning point might be near. These remarks follow heightened tensions and Israeli strikes on Iranian sites, fueling speculation about broader conflict.

title: PM busted Congress lies; Cong claims Trump-Munir meet 'jhatka' to diplomacy
content: Amidst ongoing political sparring, Congress criticizes the government over Pakistan's army chief's meeting with Trump, labeling it a diplomatic setback. BJP retaliates, asserting Modi's conversation with Trump on Operation Sindoor refuted Congress's claims of mediation. The party insists India firmly rejects third-party intervention, accusing Congress of spreading misinformation to undermine India's foreign policy.

title: Putin proposes Iran-Israel peace talks; Trump tells him to focus on Ukraine
content: Amid escalating Middle East tensions, Vladimir Putin offered Russia's mediation between Iran and Israel, citing Moscow's unique ties. He revealed proposals shared with Iran, Israel, and the U.S. for de-escalation. While Trump dismissed the offer, Putin highlighted Russia's nuclear cooperation with Iran, assuring Israel of security measures.

title: Israel-Iran conflict: This number could define outcome - The missile math explained
content: The escalating conflict between Iran and Israel hinges on Iran's remaining medium-range ballistic missiles (MRBMs). After firing approximately 700 MRBMs, estimates place Iran's remaining stockpile between 300 and 1,300. Damage to Iranian infrastructure and missile production capabilities, coupled with potential foreign support, further complicates the situation, potentially forcing Iran into negotiations or escalation.

title: PM in Croatia: No solutions from battlefields; leaders agree to boost def ties
content: PM Modi's visit to Zagreb marked the first by an Indian PM, leading to discussions with Croatian counterpart Andrej Plenkovic. Both leaders emphasized dialogue and diplomacy over conflict, particularly amid escalating global tensions.

title: G7 Summit: PM Narendra Modi slams double standards on terror
content: At the G7 outreach session, PM Modi strongly condemned terrorism, citing the Pahalgam attack as an assault on humanity. He criticized double standards in combating terror, noting India's neighborhood as a breeding ground. Modi questioned the international community's seriousness in addressing terrorism and highlighted the impact of global conflicts on the Global South.

title: With eye on Iran, Trump hosts Pak army chief Munir for White House lunch
content: US President Trump hosted Pakistan's Army Chief Asim Munir, declaring his affection for Pakistan and claiming to have prevented a war with India, despite India's denial of his mediation. This meeting, initiated by a Pakistani-American businessman, occurred amidst potential US action against Iran.

title: ATP tour in India: What a toll pass means for your drive on national highways
content: The Indian government is launching an 'Annual Toll Pass' (ATP) on August 15th for private car owners, allowing seamless travel on NHAI-managed highways. Priced at ₹3,000 annually, it offers 200 trips, with each toll plaza crossing counting as one trip. This pass, linked to FASTag, aims to provide a cost-effective alternative for frequent travelers, though FASTag will remain an option.

title: Ahmedabad plane crash: Body of Kuki flight attendant from Manipur to land in Nagaland
content: Air India flight attendant Lamnunthem Singson, a Kuki woman, will be buried in Kangpokpi, Manipur, her body rerouted via Dimapur due to ethnic tensions. Imphal was avoided despite being closer. Meanwhile, Kongbrailatpam Nganth8oi Sharma, a Meitei colleague, remains unidentified, her sister awaiting DNA confirmation in Ahmedabad. The Meitei Heritage Society has condemned attempts to politicize the tragic plane crash.

title: IST to be mandatory time reference, govt asks banks, Sebi to discontinue using other systems
content: The Indian government is set to mandate Indian Standard Time (IST) for all official activities, aiming to eliminate reliance on foreign systems like GPS. This move, driven by cybersecurity concerns and past incidents, involves an indigenous timekeeping system developed by NPL and ISRO. The initiative promises enhanced security for digital transactions, accurate billing, and reduced cybercrime risks through synchronized timekeeping.

title: Modi’s tele-conversation with Trump exposed ‘lies’ of Congress: BJP
content: BJP IT cell head Amit Malviya says Congress must stop maligning India’s firm and principled foreign policy just to feed its petty narratives

title: Pandarachira canal in West Kochi to be restored with international funding
content: The move comes close on the heels of criticism that canals in West Kochi were overlooked under the IURWTS, a project to restore six critical canals in the city

title: MUFA members stage sit-in protest at MKU demanding promotions
content: 100 lecturers, 85 assistant professors and 15 associate professors are yet to get their promotion orders despite their eligibility and participation in the CAS process, says association

title: 911 houses damaged due to natural calamities in Dakshina Kannada since April: DDMA
content: Outgoing DC Muhilan says that horticultural crops on 5.384 hectares and agricultural crops on 2.43 hectares were affected due to the rains

title: Bills to amend nuclear energy laws ‘may’ be introduced in Monsoon Session: Minister
content: Centre may consider amendments to Atomic Energy Act, Civil Liability for Nuclear Damage Act as promised by Finance Minister while announcing nuclear energy mission; could remove hurdles for private investment

title: Sources: Buss family to sell Lakers, valued at $10B
content: The Buss family is entering into an agreement to sell majority ownership of the Lakers to Mark Walter, who also owns the Dodgers, for a franchise valuation of approximately $10 billion, sources told ESPN.

title: Browns rookie Sanders cited for driving 101 mph
content: Browns rookie quarterback Shedeur Sanders was cited by police early Tuesday morning for driving 101 mph in a 60 mph zone, according to police records.

title: Sources: Draft prospect Bailey cancels 76ers visit
content: Former Rutgers star Ace Bailey has canceled a visit to the Philadelphia 76ers, sources told ESPN, and has yet to visit any NBA teams ahead of next week's NBA draft.

title: Rays' 8-run comeback largest in MLB this season
content: The Rays overcame an eight-run deficit to beat the Orioles 12-8 on Wednesday night in the largest comeback in the majors this season, which also matched Tampa Bay's biggest comeback in franchise history.

title: Yanks finally score, otherwise sputter in latest loss
content: The Yankees scored their first runs after 30 straight scoreless innings, but still fell 3-2 to the Angels on Wednesday night for their sixth consecutive loss.

title: LSU plates three runs in 9th, makes MCWS finals
content: Down to its last out, LSU capitalized on a two-run miscue by Arkansas in the ninth inning before posting a walk-off victory to advance to the Men's College World Series finals.

title: Singer defied Dodgers, belted anthem in Spanish
content: Latin singer Nezza said that she is "super proud" of performing the national anthem in Spanish, despite being discouraged from doing so by the Dodgers, and that she has "no regrets."

title: Panthers damage Stanley Cup amid celebration
content: The Florida Panthers managed to crack and dent the Stanley Cup trophy within 24 hours of winning their second straight  championship.

title: Trade Giannis or build around him? 8 deals the Bucks should consider
content: Milwaukee could choose to retool its roster this summer. Will the two-time MVP still be a Buck when the dust settles?

title: How the Thunder win it all and the Pacers force Game 7
content: NBA insiders answer the biggest questions and what to watch for heading into this massive Finals Game 6.

title: MLB mock draft 2.0: Kiley McDaniel predicts the first 40 picks
content: The Men's College World Series is bringing the top of next month's draft into better focus, starting with a new No. 1 pick.

title: The ultimate NFL team from past 25 years: Who makes the 53-man roster, practice squad and coaching staff?
content: In honor of hitting the quarter-century mark, we built a 53-man roster of the best NFL players from the past 25 years. Who makes the team?

title: Club World Cup updates, odds: Real Madrid draw shows scale of Alonso's task
content: Real Madrid's tournament began with a fizzle vs. Al Hilal, while Phil Foden fired Man City to an opening win over Wydad AC. Here's what you need to know as Wednesday unfolds in the Club World Cup.

title: Xabi says Madrid makeover 'a process' after draw
content: Xabi Alonso called for patience after Real Madrid's 1-1 draw with Al Hilal in their opening game at the Club World Cup, saying implementing the changes he wants to make "will take time."

title: Poch: USMNT not playing to get revenge on critics
content: USMNT coach Mauricio Pochettino said he's not seeking vengeance against his critics after a positive start for the men's national team in the 2025 Gold Cup.

title: Alba returning, Messi fit as Miami faces Porto
content: Inter Miami CF head coach Javier Mascherano said Jordi Alba and Lionel Messi will both be available for selection tomorrow in the team's second Club World Cup group stage match against FC Porto at Mercedes-Benz Stadium in Atlanta.

title: Mudryk faces up to 4-year ban after doping charge
content: Mykhailo Mudryk is facing a potential ban of up to four years after the Football Association charged the Chelsea winger with a doping offence.

title: Juventus net five in commanding CWC opener
content: Randal Kolo Muani and Francisco Conceição both scored twice, leading Juventus to a dominant 5-0 victory over Al Ain in their Club World Cup debut in Washington, D.C. on Wednesday night.

title: Man Utd fans fume at 'eye-watering' ticket prices
content: Manchester United fans have hit out at the club for what they say are "eye-watering" ticket increases that are a "kick in the teeth" for supporters.

title: Laporta: Barça working on 'really exciting signing'
content: Barcelona president Joan Laporta says the Spanish champions are working on a "really exciting signing" after completing a deal to bring in Joan García.

title: Pep laments 'unnecessary' Lewis red in City win
content: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola described Rico Lewis' 88th-minute red card in Wednesday's 2-0 win over Wydad AC as an "unnecessary" decision by the referee.

content: The group stage at the Concacaf Gold Cup is well underway, and here's what every country needs to reach the quarterfinals.

title: Trump Hosts Pak's Asim Munir For Lunch, Cites This Reason For Inviting Him
content: US President Donald Trump on Wednesday praised Pakistan Army Chief Asim Munir for his alleged role in preventing an escalation of the conflict between India and Pakistan, as he hosted the latter for a lunch meeting at the White House.

title: Iran's Silent Allies: Baghdad To Beirut, Why Is No One Picking Up The Phone
content: For more than four decades, Iran has built an alliance of proxy forces across the Middle East, a self-styled "Axis of Resistance", to project power, repel US and Israeli influence, and insulate itself from direct confrontation.

title: After Air India Crash, New Rules For Structures Near Airports
content: In a key step after the deadly Air India Boeing 787 Dreamliner crash, the Ministry of Civil Aviation has released new draft rules to tighten control over physical structures that may pose risk to aircraft safety.

title: "Sanjay Is Raj": Mystery Behind 234 Calls In Honeymoon Murder Case Solved

title: End Inequality To Be Truly Democratic, Says Chief Justice Of India
